title: BBC Local Live: Cumbria for Tuesday 24 October 2017 - BBC News
summary: driver dies after high harrington crash .
county police 'lead way in dealing with modern slavery ' .
abuse inquiry to send team to cumbria .
cumbrians lobby in london for schools cash .
one farmer 's contribution to war in the trenches - 500 ferrets a month .

documents.title: chester 3-2 barrow
text: chester 3-2 barrow
author: Ged Scott
BBC Sport

documents.title: our live coverage across the day
text: we 've now finished posting news , travel reports , a regular weather forecast and the odd other nugget from the county , for today .
here 's a reminder :
we 'll be back to do it again from 08:00 tomorrow .

in the meantime , if you want to pass on news you think we should know , or share a photo with the county , you can email them to us , send them using twitter where we 're @ twitterid or head to our facebook page .
have a very good evening .
author: Martin Lewes
Reporter

documents.title: driver who died after high harrington crash is named
text: police have released the name of the driver who died yesterday when his ford fiesta hit a tree at high harrington , near workington , at the weekend .
he was conor brannon , 23 , from maryport .
a woman passenger is still critically ill in hospital in newcastle , while two other men who were in the rear seats are in hospitals in cumbria , both with serious injuries .

documents.title: cumbria police show others the way on saving modern slaves
text: cumbria 's police have been showing other forces best practice in educating officers on how to spot people trafficking and slavery , according to the county 's police commissioner peter mccall .
in the past year the county 's police have had more than 200 reports , although mr mccall said they would not all turn out to be borne out by investigations .

the report , which is highly critical of many constabularies , praises cumbria 's force for the way officers have been trained to spot the signs that workers may be under duress , and to take action .
mr mccall said cumbrian officers were already being asked to pass on what they were doing .
is n't it great that for folk in cumbria to know that their force is leading the way in a developing area of crime ? ''

documents.title: cumbria 's weather : rain rolls in again
text: the rain may become heavier and more persistent during the evening and first part of the night .
however , this should clear allowing it to turn drier with clear spells by dawn .
you can find the latest bbc weather forecast for where you are , here .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: timber comes out with a snigger at windermere
text: it 's called `` snigging '' , the centuries-old practice of using horses to drag timber out of woodland .

south lakeland council 's brought in simon lenihan from celtic horse logging from grange to help clear out trunks and branches felled in the process of thinning out woodland on school knott at windermere .
employing horses is seen as better than using machinery because it does n't pack the ground down or do other damage .
and before you ask , the horse is called roscoe .
author: Martin Lewes
Reporter

documents.title: it 's been wet , say james , who 's keeping count
text: if you think it has been a wet few months , then james robinson , who farms an organic dairy herd near kendal , can prove it .
115 days since 1st aug and we 've had 95days of rain ( inc 22 out of 24 in oct ) no wonder everything is bloomin wet !
how abnormal is that for your area james ?
it would be devastating here .
i would think that 's double the amount of rain days for our part of the country .
it 's been a struggle i can tell you !
suspect more challenges to come before the spring .
# longwinter
there have been 30 dry days here , s wales , since the 1st july ( 115 days ) and 4 dry days in october- 85 days of rain .
hellish eh ? !
maybe we 'll have it dry for the next few months !
you need to get on to god james - sure you must have his mobile ?
more consecutive days of drought in spain
that is a ton of rain as u know all to well !
115 days since 1st july obviously , not that it changes the fact that over 4 out of 5 days have been wet
cows still out james ?
at least you have plenty of grass !
just 30 heifers out , but they 've 5 mouths !
between them or each ?
the wonders of modern genetics
also i do n't envy you one bit !
that looks and sounds wet

similar story here , i was hopeful that last wks storms might bring about a change , but it did n't happen , absolutely teeming down again today
think been the same here !
& lots mother-in-laws bought rain gauge me lol but every am have had 1/2 in to 11/2 ins better 2018 pleasy
no one in somerset can believe kendal can have rain 4 days out of 5 it 's dry down here in comparison
it 's why it so green and lovely grass

documents.title: cumbria treated to first view of bbc hit drama the a word
text: a cumbrian audience is set to get a first glimpse of the new series of the hit bbc drama the a word .
author: News and Star
Newspaper

documents.title: magic of lake and lights helps hos raise funds
text: the eden valley hos held another lake of light show at talkin tarn at the weekend , attracting more than 2,000 people .
one of them was owen humphreys , a news photographer who really captured the magic .
staff at the hos say they 're still considering whether to hold a similar event next year .

documents.title: man dies and three injured in car crash
text: man dies and three injured in car crash

documents.title: barrow mp sees 'contrasting government views on isis '
text: barrow labour mp john woodcock claims not all ministers in the foreign office share the same views on fighters returning from the so-called islamic state as the penrith and the border mp rory stewart , who 's also minister for international development .
earlier this week mr stewart said most isis fighters were so radicalised that they would have to be be killed on the battlefield .

but after an exchange in the house of commons today mr woodcock tweeted that another foreign office minister , alistair burt , had suggested returning british jihadis `` could play a role exposing true nature of daesh regime that seduced them in attempt to stop others being radicalised '' .
mr woodock suggested this would be a brave move by mr burt .
big difference between foreign ministers alistair burt and rory stewart on future of brits rad valises by daesh .
rs said at weekend 1/3
2/3 nearly all were so dangerous they have to be killed on the battlefield , but ab says in commons just now that returning british jihadis
3/4 could play a role exposing true nature of daesh regime that seduced them in attempt to stop others being radicalised .
it would be a very
4/4 big and controversial call to allow brits back into the uk after they 've gone to fight uk armed forces abroad .
should never be allowed back in to this country it 's an absolute disgrace putting british people 's lives at stake .

documents.title: train union sets new dates for strike in guards row
text: the railway union , the rmt , says its members will hold another two day strike on northern train services across the north of england .
the action , which will affect trains on a number of lines in cumbria , is in a dispute over the role of guards , will be on the 8 and 9 november

documents.title: off-duty animal officers save brampton drain bird
text: a holiday in the country became work for three yorkshire rspca officers after they found a bird trapped in a drainpipe .
the trio discovered the trapped wren at their holiday cottage near brampton , cumbria .
they were alerted by the `` scuffling '' sound of the wren as they headed out on a walk .
the rspca said the officers were `` huge animal lovers '' who `` could never turn their backs on an animal in need '' .
`` [ the bird ] was obviously very frightened and distressed as he kept trying to jump back up the pipe but lucy managed to get hold of him so we could manoeuvre him and get him out , '' she said .
`` he was a bit dazed and battered but , thankfully , did n't appear to have any serious injuries .

documents.title: one cumbrian farmer 's war effort : 500 ferrets a month
text: james rebanks , the cumbrian hill farmer with just under 100,000 followers for his herdwick shepherd twitterfeed , has just found out what his ancestor 's contribution to world war one involved .
the ferrest were used to kill rats in the trenches .
just discovered that my great great grandfather had the order to supply british army with 500 ferrets a month for w. front @ jlewisstempel
what were they used for ?
rabbiting .
rabbits were a huge element of protein inputs in 1917-1918 .
they were also a huge problem in agriculture behind the lines .
thank you michael .
i never knew that .
makes sense .
i have only recently become aware of this and informed !
have a look at this site
everyone had their role .
what did the army need that many ferrets for james ?
seriously ? ?
why has that lady got a lobster claw ?
thank you for fascinating thread
my great grandfather was a vet and was responsible for buying horses in the us .
torpedoed on one trip , died at 93 .
what did they do with ferrets ?
kill .
rats .
ratsh ? ''
i feel like there are very few people who can lay claim to this .

documents.title: cumbria 's weather : brighter but a risk of showers
text: there could be some brighter weather and even some sunshine this afternoon , but there 'll also be some heavy showers , and the rain will return tonight .
temperatures could reach 16c ( 61f ) .
you can find the latest bbc weather forecast for where you are , here .
author: BBC Weather

text: off-duty animal officers save drain bird

documents.title: carlisle 's nick miller takes aim at gold coast games
text: nick miller from carlisle has been named in the team england squad for the gold coast 2018 commonwealth games .
nick , 24 , was a silver medallist at the 2014 games , and took gold at the 2015 european under 23 championships .
author: BBC Cumbria Sport

documents.title: driver darren plans a holiday and home after lottery win
text: darren taylor from whitehaven and his wife vicky are celebrating a £ 300,000 win in a national lottery online game .
the couple , who have four children , are planning to take a holiday in florida and then buy a home .
darren , who drives a refuse truck for copeland council , says he plans to buy his colleagues breakfast as well .
it is wonderful that this win will not only benefit vicky and i , but all of the family too . ''

documents.title: carlisle city aims to list the unlisted but important
text: buildings , structures and landscapes that matter to people living in carlisle could be given greater protection .

the city council wants to draw up a local list , which would identify important heritage assets that are not protected by in other ways , as buildings such as the famous castle are , but which `` make a significant contribution to the historic environment and sense of place '' .
the list would be taken into consideration when planning applications are submitted .

documents.title: abuse inquiry to seek evidence in cumbria
text: the independent inquiry set up in the wake of scandals such as that involving jimmy savile is sending staff to cumbria in the hope that people who were abused as children in an institutional setting will come forward .
announced by the then home secretary theresa may in 2014 and led by professor alexis jay , it 's examining the extent to which organisations have failed to protect children in england and wales .

evidence from the county will be gathered by the truth project , where victims can talk in confidence and in a supportive environment to a counsellor about their experience , get support and suggest how abuse can be prevented .
there 's more information here .

documents.title: travel : lorry breakdown slows traffic on a66
text: a broken-down lorry is blocking the westbound carriageway of the a66 between crackenthorpe and bolton .
police say delays are expected .
author: BBC News Travel

documents.title: travel : flooding issues remain on m6 , a592 and a590
text: the rain is dying out in south cumbria now , but flooding is reported on the a592 from newby bridge through to bowness , and on the a590 at the park road roundabout in barrow .
there is also lot of surface water on the m6 around junction 35 for carnforth .
author: BBC News Travel

documents.title: cumbrians head to london to lobby for schools cash
text: teachers , parents and children from cumbria are going to london today to try to put pressure on the chancellor to give more money to schools .
the government says it 's providing more money , but teachers say there are more pupils in their schools , so it does n't cover the rising costs .
helen jackman from the penrith and carlisle parents against school cuts group will address the rally today .
we want mps to take the issues to the chancellor before the budget in november . ''

documents.title: cumbria police praised in slavery report
text: cumbria 's police force has been praised for the way it has dealt with the problems of modern slavery .

in a national report that was critical of many forces , inspectors said officers were given a special briefing on the problem , and it highlighted an example where a man reporting his problems to a police station led to a major operation within two hours .
the report said that overall , `` we found that the police service has much to do if it is to develop an effective , coherent and consistent response to modern slavery and human trafficking '' .

but in cumbria , it said , officers were given a special briefing about local cases : `` this reinforced messages about what signs to look out for , making these messages more relevant to officers and to the area where they worked . ''
frontline officers we spoke to were generally confident that they could spot the signs of modern slavery and human trafficking . ''
author: Martin Lewes
Reporter

documents.title: weather on the fell tops : claggy , then sunny
text: weather on the fell tops : claggy , then sunny

documents.title: travel : breakdown blocks one lane on m6 northbound
text: one lane is closed because a vehicle has broken down on the northbound carriageway between junctions 38 for tebay and 39 for shap .
traffic is coping well .
author: BBC News Travel

documents.title: driver in high harrington crash dies
text: a driver from maryport who was critically injured when the car he was driving hit a tree on sunday has now died in hospital .
a female passenger remains in a critical condition after the accident , which happened in high harrington , near workington .
a second man from maryport is still in the west cumberland hospital in whitehaven and a third man from salterbeck is in the cumberland infirmary in carlisle with serious injuries .

documents.title: travel : flooding on a590 at barrow
text: there are reports of flooding on several parts of the a590 in the barrow area , but traffic is said to be coping well .
author: BBC News Travel

documents.title: cumbria 's weather : cloudy , breezy and mild
text: it 'll be a cloudy and breezy morning with outbreaks of rain passing eastwards .
it 'll be milder with a maximum temperature of 15c ( 59f ) and a fresh southwesterly wind .
you can find the latest bbc weather forecast for where you are , here .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: welcome to bbc cumbria live
text: good morning : we 'll be posting the news , a regular weather forecast , travel reports , and maybe the other odd thing that catches our eyes from around this county through today .

as always , if you want to pass on news you think we should know , or share a photo with the county , you can email them to us , send them using twitter where we 're @ twitterid or head to our facebook page .
author: Martin Lewes
Reporter
